item.title: Chart: Homicides haven't only increased in Britain
item.description:
The homicide-rate increase over the past five years hasnâ€™t been unique to England and Wales, with murders also increasing in France, Germany and Sweden after continent-wide decreases since the 1990s. The UK-wide homicide rate remains about average for European countries.

larger image | annotated R code to produce this chart

Data source: Eurostat, 2019 database tables crim_off_cat and crim_gen with population data from table demo_pjan.
